channel.title: [Hyperion] Sounds
channel.description: I know I need to add a MIDI sequencer and all that, but how do I get it all to work with Hyperion's JAGGRAB system, and the packet that handles sounds?

item.title: [Hyperion] Sounds
item.dc:creator: @xVhincex xVhincex
item.description:
@xVhincex wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:10, topic:464608”][quote author=xVhincex link=topic=568673.msg4127841#msg4127841 date=1350687642]

Well here’s the packet

[code]public ActionSender sendSound(int sound, int volume, int delay) {
PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(174);
bldr.putShort(sound).put((byte) volume).putShort(delay);
player.getSession().write(bldr.toPacket());
return this;

}
[/code]
dunno if it works with the client youre using

I already got it server sided, I need the client side code.

I just tried adding sound to the client, but it’s really tricky since it’s a non-renamed client…

Why not just use MITB’s 317 Renamed client?
If you want the JAGGRAB system just simply uncomment it from the client.java file in the renamed client
Then you can jar it, use it as a web client
[/quote]
Oh I guess I could do that. I didn’t know MITB had a renamed client tbh lol[/quote]

yeah =p http://uppit.com/v/GRYCAMNO
for a packaged version of the client http://www.mediafire.com/?untgmmnnhjn

Read full topic

Well here’s the packet

[code]public ActionSender sendSound(int sound, int volume, int delay) {
PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(174);
bldr.putShort(sound).put((byte) volume).putShort(delay);
player.getSession().write(bldr.toPacket());
return this;

}
[/code]
dunno if it works with the client youre using

I already got it server sided, I need the client side code.
[/quote]

I just tried adding sound to the client, but it’s really tricky since it’s a non-renamed client…

Why not just use MITB’s 317 Renamed client?
If you want the JAGGRAB system just simply uncomment it from the client.java file in the renamed client
Then you can jar it, use it as a web client[/quote]
Oh I guess I could do that. I didn’t know MITB had a renamed client tbh lol

item.title: [Hyperion] Sounds
item.dc:creator: @xVhincex xVhincex
item.description:
@xVhincex wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:8, topic:464608”][quote author=xVhincex link=topic=568673.msg4127822#msg4127822 date=1350686142]
Well here’s the packet

[code]public ActionSender sendSound(int sound, int volume, int delay) {
PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(174);
bldr.putShort(sound).put((byte) volume).putShort(delay);
player.getSession().write(bldr.toPacket());
return this;

}
[/code]
dunno if it works with the client youre using
[/quote]
I already got it server sided, I need the client side code.[/quote]

I just tried adding sound to the client, but it’s really tricky since it’s a non-renamed client…

Why not just use MITB’s 317 Renamed client?
If you want the JAGGRAB system just simply uncomment it from the client.java file in the renamed client
Then you can jar it, use it as a web client

Read full topic

item.title: [Hyperion] Sounds
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“relentlesspk, post:4, topic:464608”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=568673.msg4127768#msg4127768 date=1350680568]
I do…
[/quote]
The one with the music system implemented?[/quote]
That actually isn’t a client that works truly with Hyperion, seeing as Hyperion using JAGGRAB (server side cache), which this client has removed, and, it is renamed, when Hyperion comes with a 317 deob with working JAGGRAB and all that.

Read full topic
